page.title: 14CHANGING TIMES
page.content: We asked some people who had always lived here what changes They had seen since the end of the War.They told us that it was much busier.They remembered when the baker had a horse drawn trap changed it for a van but went back to the cart because he prefered it.The refuse was collected in a cart too. The population was smaller and there were few new houses.People were either tradesmen,farm labourers,shop assistants or they were businessmen who left early to work in Glasgow coming home by steamer.We asked if there had been fewer shops and although neither{Cove }nor{Kilcreggan village is in our square we feel this answer is of importance in understanding just what has happened here.The reply was there had been more shops and not just the village store
